required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Local Pressure on Muscle Activity and General Relaxation in Persons With Hypertonia Following Stroke
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Local Pressure Application on Muscle Activity and General Relaxation in Persons With Hypertonia Following Stroke

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to examine the effect of - both constant as intermittent - local application of deep pressure on muscle activity and general relaxation in persons with hypertonia following stroke.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will be carried out in 20 persons with hypertonia following stroke. There will be one single test occasion, during which 6 test trials will be performed in random order. Deep pressure will be applied by means of a Johnstone air splint, that will be (1) not inflated, (2) inflated constantly, or (3) inflated intermittently. Each of these 3 inflation conditions will be performed twice, i.e. with and without a non-hemiplegic arm movement (triggering hypertonia at hemiplegic side).

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: electromyographic frequency analysis of biceps brachii muscle activity at the hemiplegic side

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: electromyographic frequency analysis of triceps brachii muscle activity at the hemiplegic side

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: electromyographic frequency analysis of pectoralis major muscle activity at the hemiplegic side

primary_outcome.measure: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major muscle tone
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major muscle tone

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: heart rate measurement assessed with the Zehpyr bioharness

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: heart rate variability assessed with the Zehpyr bioharness

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: respiratory rate assessed with the Zehpyr bioharness

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
primary_outcome.description: visual analogue scale rating of the intensity of hypertonia, in which the degree of hypertonia has to be situated between "0" (no hypertonia) and "10" (very severe hypertonia)

secondary_outcome.measure: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major elasticity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
secondary_outcome.description: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major elasticity

secondary_outcome.measure: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major stiffness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 5 months
secondary_outcome.description: MyotonPRO measurement of pectoralis major stiffness

arm_group.description: splint around the arm is not inflated both arms are in rest during the entire trial
splint around the arm is not inflated 5x flexion and extension with the contralateral arm (with weight of 5kg in the hands)
splint around the arm is constantly inflated both arms are in rest during the entire trial
splint around the arm is constantly inflated 5x flexion and extension with the contralateral arm (with weight of 5kg in the hands)
splint around the arm is intermittently inflated both arms are in rest during the entire trial
splint around the arm is intermittently inflated 5x flexion and extension with the contralateral arm (with weight of 5kg in the hands)

intervention.intervention_name: constant deep pressure applied by an air splint
intervention.description: inflation of the Johnstone air splint gives a constant local deep pression on the hemiplegic arm

intervention.intervention_name: intermittent deep pressure applied by an air splint
intervention.description: continuous inflation and deflation of the Johnstone air splint gives an intermittent local deep pression on the hemiplegic arm
no deep pressure applied by the air splint
non-hemiplegic arm is flexed and extended 5 times, with a weight of 5kg in the hand, in order to trigger hypertonia in the hemiplegic arm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- subacute stroke (<6 months)
- hypertonia (Modified Ashworth Scale score of â‰¥2 for arm flexors at the hemiplegic side)
